intro: Fumaria muralis var. lowei, commonly known as the wall rue, is a flowering plant belonging to the poppy family, Papaveraceae. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are typically alternate, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. This variety is often found growing on walls, rocks, and in disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and somewhat rare species within its native range.
